title: Cohort-Based Integrated Dissertation Guidance Strategy for Doctoral Students in Education: Enhancing Academic Expression, Research Text Analysis, and Logical Structure

context.prior_knowledge: Masterâ€™s degree or higher, foundational research methodology knowledge, professional practice experience, basic understanding of academic writing and text analysis, and familiarity with APA style guidelines
context.additional_context: An intensive workshop where professionals systematically master the academic writing process through cohort-based collaboration. Participants receive targeted training in critical reading of research literature, precision in scholarly expression, logical structuring of academic texts, and appropriate lexical choices.

learning_goals: Cohort members can collaboratively develop a step-by-step roadmap from topic selection to data analysis, systematically structuring text using academic vocabulary and expression strategies aligned with research objectives.

Learners can draft one research design using an integrated thesis guidance model (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude), critically analyze five or more academic papers, and produce one research interpretation report. They can also complete one abstract and three structured text sections (introduction/methods/conclusion) adhering to APA style guidelines.

Based on peer feedback and instructor support, learners can develop strategies to optimize time management and workload while enhancing their ability to systematically present research findings and strengthen logical organization.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
